directions: Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat.  Stir in the onion and green pepper; cook until the onion begins to turn brown, about 5 minutes.  Pour in the water, white beans, tomato sauce, garlic, cilantro, and calabaza.  Season with the sazon packet, bouillon cube, salt, pepper, and cumin; stir well to combine.

Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to a simmer, cover, and cook until the calabaza has softened, about 20 minutes.  Remove the cover, and continue cooking until the sauce has thickened, about 10 more minutes.
ingredients: 1/4 cup calabaza (pumpkin-like squash), peeled and medium diced
1 (.18 ounce) packet sazon with coriander and achiote
1 cube chicken with tomato flavored bouillon
title: Caribbean White Beans
